review.text: Part three was so wretched, it actually made you miss the Wayans brothers, but the fourth Scary Movie has its share of good laughs. It unspools like a Mad magazine parody, primarily of The Grudge and War of the Worlds , but also some lesser targets both obvious (Saw ) and not (Fahrenheit 9/11 ). Anna Faris returns, this time channeling Sarah Michelle Gellar , while Craig Bierko —underrated as a comic actor—goes to town on Hollywood 's biggest target, Tom Cruise . (Other good spoof-casting choices include Chris Elliott for Adrien Brody and Bill Pullman for William Hurt in The Village , and Charlie Sheen for Pullman in The Grudge .) The jokes miss more than they hit, but there are a lot of them, and when they work, it's gold. (A gag that involves a car's automatic-locking system is utterly brilliant.) And given that director David Zucker recently became a Republican, bonus points for all the jokes involving Leslie Nielsen as a familiarly bumbling president.
